definition: to overturn (a vehicle)/to capsize/to turn upside down/to change completely
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: It was the big waves that capsized the boat.
The fisherman almost got drowned when his boat was overturned.
sentences.chinese: 當漁夫的船翻覆時，他幾乎淹死。

sentences.english: A bus overturned on the freeway, blocking the off-ramp.
sentences.chinese: 一輛公車在調整公路上翻覆，堵住了出口匝道。

sentences.english: But the stormy sea must have capsized the boat by now.
sentences.chinese: 但在暴風雨的海上它現在一定是翻覆了。

sentences.english: The truck skidded off the road, hit a tree and overturned.
sentences.chinese: 卡車滑下路面，撞到一棵樹上，翻覆了。

sentences.english: In this city I'm in every night in overturned.
sentences.chinese: 在這城市我於每夜輾轉翻覆。

sentences.english: A truck that had jackknifed was blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 一輛卡車昨天在中山北路翻覆，造成交通回堵。

sentences.english: It seems that a truck carrying swimming pool chemicals has overturned about 15 minutes ago.
sentences.chinese: 在15分鐘前一輛載泳池藥劑的卡車在此處翻覆。

sentences.english: A truck overturned on Zhongshan N. Rd. and caused traffic to back up yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 一輛卡車昨天在中山北路翻覆，造成交通回堵。

sentences.english: If there are too many people on the canoe, it may capsize.
sentences.chinese: 如果太多的人乘坐一艘獨木舟，它可能會翻覆。

definition: grave danger/in jeopardy/in a critical condition
the situation (e.g. political)/the state of the world
to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
